page.title: 04LOCHGOILHEAD-ECOLOGY(1)
page.content:
Lochgoilhead is a glaciated,hilly area of old,hard rocks ({schists and vein {quartz}) rising from 0-901 metres.
{CLIMATE.}The climate is mild and wet. {Min Max} Ave. Daily Temp. Jan. 1 6 (degrees celsius) July 11 19 {Rainfall-2480mm / annum.} { {SOILS. {Podsolization}and{gleying}and{peat}are common.
{ANIMALS. There are 20+ mammals species including{red}and{roe deer,blue hare,} {wild cat,badger}and{red squirrel. {Feral mink}are increasing but,{ unfortunately{otters}have gone.{Voles {and mice}are important in many food chains.
